title: Homemade Dawn Powerwash: Easy Recipe for Refills

steps.title: You can use the empty Dawn Powerwash container or your own bottle.
steps.content: You can use the empty Dawn Powerwash container or your own bottle. If you use your own bottle, choose a 16 fl oz (470 ml) bottle that has a sprayer. If you only have larger bottles, that's fine—just double the ingredients. [1] X Research source If you're trying to use fewer plastic products, get a mason jar with a spray lid attachment .

steps.title: Take your bottle to the sink and fill it to about 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the top.
steps.content: Take your bottle to the sink and fill it to about 1 inch (2.5 cm) from the top. It's fine to eyeball this amount, but if you want to be precise, fill a measuring cup with 13 fluid ounces (380 ml) of water and slowly pour it into the bottle. [2] X Research source For the cleanest product, use distilled water —it's free from impurities that can leave streaks or residue behind.

steps.title: Add 4 US tbsp (59 ml) of Dawn for the main cleaning ingredient.
steps.content: Add 4 US tbsp (59 ml) of Dawn for the main cleaning ingredient. To make classic Dawn Powerwash, use blue Dawn Original Dish Soap . Feel free to try a different type of Dawn dish soap if it's what you have on hand. [3] X Research source Stick a small funnel in the bottle to make it easier to add the soap and rubbing alcohol.

steps.title: Use 2 US tbsp (30 ml) of rubbing alcohol for stain removal.
steps.content: Use 2 US tbsp (30 ml) of rubbing alcohol for stain removal. Rubbing alcohol might be something you stick in the first aid kit, but it's a fantastic cleaning product since it lifts stubborn stains. Just pour the rubbing alcohol into the bottle of water. [4] X Research source If you don't have rubbing alcohol, substitute the same amount of white vinegar.

steps.title: Customize the scent of your homemade Dawn Powerwash.
steps.content: Customize the scent of your homemade Dawn Powerwash. Although the solution has the classic scent of Dawn liquid dish soap, you can add your own fragrance. Just mix in about 5 drops of essential oils before you use your Dawn Powerwash. For instance, add rosemary or pine essential oils for a strong, woodsy scent. Try lemon or orange essential oil to make a bright, citrusy smell. Add tea tree or mint essential oil for a sharp, fresh scent.

steps.title: Shake gently, so the product doesn't foam up too much.
steps.content: Shake gently, so the product doesn't foam up too much. Just turn the bottle upside down and right side up a few times, so the soap and rubbing alcohol combine with the water. Now, you're all set! [5] X Research source If you've used your own bottle and find that the solution is getting clogged in the nozzle, dilute your homemade Dawn Powerwash with more water and try again.

steps.title: Try it throughout your home to lift stubborn stains and grease.
steps.content: Try it throughout your home to lift stubborn stains and grease. You probably already reach for Dawn Powerwash when you're doing dishes, but it's handy for other kitchen tasks. Spray it on stainless steel appliances , wipe down grimy cabinets , use it as a window cleaner , and spray it on clothes with tough stains. Here are a few more ideas for using your Dawn Powerwash: [6] X Research source Clean outdoor furniture Wash your bathtub or shower Deep-clean your stove or oven Treat carpet stains Scrub your grill grates
